title: Chicken tortilla soup
shorttext: There is a deli not too far from my house that makes the best chicken tortilla soup.
longtext: There is a deli not too far from my house that makes the best chicken tortilla soup. I love this soup—it’s the perfect lunch! The soup is thickened using crumbled corn tortillas, giving it a wonderful fresh flavor. The tortilla-thickened broth and shredded chicken make for a very filling meal. And I love the crispy tortilla strips, perfect for dipping!

title: Chile relleno
shorttext: A fresh chile stuffed with Monterey Jack cheese.
longtext: A fresh chile stuffed with Monterey Jack cheese, dipped in egg batter and covered with Salsa Ranchera.

title: Chilaquiles
shorttext: Chilaquiles is one of my favorite Mexican dishes.
longtext: Chilaquiles is one of my favorite Mexican dishes. It’s a simple peasant dish of fried tortillas tossed in a red or green sauce. Chilaquiles can be served for dinner, but more traditionally, it’s a breakfast dish made with eggs. I decided to use chicken in place of scrambled eggs, but no one says you can’t have both. A lovely fried runny egg would be perfect over these chilaquiles! If frying up fresh tortilla chips is too much work, you can use unsalted store-bought tortilla chips.

title: Chilaqiules rojos con huevos
longtitle: Our favourite chilaqiules rojos con huevos
shorttext: Tortilla chips sautéed in our signature red sauce.
longtext: Tortilla chips sautéed in our signature red sauce topped with queso fresco and sour cream. Served with three scrambled eggs

title: Brunch tacos con chorizo
longtitle: Brunch tacos con chorizo - all day!
shorttext: Two corn tortillas with chorizo and potatoes topped with cheddar and jack cheese.
longtext: Two corn tortillas with chorizo and potatoes topped with cheddar and jack cheese and pico de gallo. Served with three scrambled eggs and applewood smoked bacon

title: Enchiladas
longtitle: The best enchiladas you've ever had
shorttext: Enchiladas! Enchiladas! Who doesn’t love enchiladas?
longtext: Enchiladas! Enchiladas! Who doesn’t love enchiladas? No joke, I just did a little cheer chanting that. In fact, I find myself chanting enchiladas often. I don’t know why, it’s one of those words that gets stuck in your head. Then the next thing I know, I’m desperately craving enchiladas. Who can blame me? They are saucy, cheesy and slap your mama delicious. One of the best things about enchiladas is that you can make them ahead of time, freeze them and have the perfect dinner on a busy day.

title: Deluxe veggie tostada
shorttext: Delicious sauteed peppers, onions and zucchini.
longtext: Delicious sauteed peppers, onions and zucchini layered with beans, lettuce, cheese, fresh pico de gallo, sour cream and guacamole.

title: Huevos rancheros
shorttext: Two eggs any style, topped with green chiles and tomatoes.
longtext: Two eggs any style, topped with green chiles and tomatoes. Served with Mexican rice, beans and guacamole.

title: Tres leche cake
longtitle: Tres leche cake like a dream
shorttext: Three milk cake topped with fresh homemade whipped cream
longtext: Three milk cake topped with fresh homemade whipped cream

title: Churro sundae
shorttext: Scoop of vanilla ice cream and sliced cinnamon churro sticks.
longtext: Scoop of vanilla ice cream, sliced cinnamon churro sticks drizzled with chocolate and caramel and topped with whipped cream

title: Flan
shorttext: Our signature house made flan with a cheesecake-like texture.
longtext: Our signature house made flan with a cheesecake-like texture.

title: Margarita lime pie
shorttext: Delicious fresh lime infused pie on a graham cracker crust.
longtext: Delicious fresh lime infused pie on a graham cracker crust, topped with a housemade fresh whipped cream

title: Cheese dip
shorttext: Cheese dips are one of my weaknesses.
longtext: Cheese dips are one of my weaknesses. If there is a cheese dip on the table or at a party, you will probably find me trying to play it cool while I hover around the dip and stuff my face. It’s hard to be discreet at the table, but when I’m at a party, I do a little drive-by dipping. The combination of crispy chips and cheesy dip is very comforting and addictive. Of course, if you don’t have the time to fry fresh tortilla chips, you can serve this dip with store-bought tortilla chips.
